betterquesting:10.desc:8:
The nature of this place is having some effects on me. The flow of time is so weird, I am not sure if I can trust my memories of not.
My memory of it appears foggy, as if I had too much to drink, but I recall a phrase, muttered by someone in Greckon; a disembodied voice. "The warden of the Shyrelands will not be happy with this."
Well, this really sounds like the voice of a subject talking about their master. But wasn't Bane supposed to be a master, a ruler?
Sure, all signs point to it. The worship, the symbolism, the portals. These places are supposed to be at the center of the Shyre Empire.
And yet this voice, a voice from a memory I do not even know to be true, this voice is telling me that things will not be over; not even when I figure out if a Fractallite can be truly put down...
